info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 7:47PM EDT until July 02 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Rabun County in northeastern Georgia... Southeastern Macon County in western North Carolina... Southwestern Transylvania County in western North Carolina... Southeastern Jackson County in western North Carolina... Northern Oconee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 747 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Franklin to 5 miles southwest of Clayton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Walhalla, Highlands, Sky Valley, Cashiers, Salem, Lake Toxaway, Lake Keowee, Lake Jocassee, Devils Fork State Park and Gorges State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
